actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to House Committee on International Relations.

official_title: A bill to authorize an intermediate term Commodity Credit Corporation credit program for the purposes of stimulating and maximizing commercial export sales of United States agricultural commodities by improving the terms, conditions, and availability of credit for the export of such commodities.
short_title: Intermediate Term Agricultural Commercial Export Credit Act

summary.text: Intermediate Term Agricultural Commercial Export Credit Act - Authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture, through the Commodity Credit Corporation, to provide intermediate export loans on terms of from three to ten years in order to develop and expand foreign markets for United States agricultural commodities. Prohibits any sale involving such intermediate credit unless the Secretary determines that such sale will develop, expand, or maintain a particular country as a long-term foreign market for United States agricultural commodities.

titles.title: Intermediate Term Agricultural Commercial Export Credit Act

A bill to authorize an intermediate term Commodity Credit Corporation credit program for the purposes of stimulating and maximizing commercial export sales of United States agricultural commodities by improving the terms, conditions, and availability of credit for the export of such commodities.
